DOC.HEADLINE: METROPOLITAN DIGEST / LOS ANGELES COUNTY NEWS IN BRIEF : VAN NUYS ; MAN PLEADS NOT GUILTY TO PAINTING GRAFFITI AT 200 SITES
DOC.TEXT: An accused tagger pleaded not_guilty Thursday to a rare felony vandalism charge filed against an adult for allegedly scrawling graffiti on 200 North Hollywood sites over a six-month period , according to the district_attorney ' s office . Jaime Anthony Rodriguez , 20 , of North Hollywood , is accused of spraying or marking his moniker , James 129 , on scores of walls , street_signs , curbs , street lights and billboards between May 3 and Nov . 29 , causing more_than $ 12 # 000 in damage , according to Deputy Dist . Atty . Mitchel Harris . Rodriguez ' s case is probably the first where prosecutors reached the felony level in an adult case by adding_up the cost of erasing the hundreds of tags , said Sandi Gibbons , spokeswoman for the district_attorney .
